1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Parse parameter specification.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Para.Parse
6  ( -- * Function
7    parseParaSpec,
8    parseParaList,
9    parseParaSingle,
10    paraBug,
11
12    -- * Layout
13    -- $Layout
14  ) where
15
16import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture               as O
17import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                   as B
18import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Para.Para       as S
19import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Para.ParaSpec   as S
20
21
22-- ----------------------  For string parameter
23
24-- | Parse parameter layout.
25--   This function divides a given string by vertical bar @"|"@,
26--   then parse each layouts.
27parseParaSpec :: String -> [(Maybe S.ParaTag, S.ParaSpec String)]
28parseParaSpec = parseParaList . B.divide '|'
29
30-- | Parse list of single layout.
31--
32--   >>> parseParaList [ "a : -a", "ab : -a -b" ]
33--   [ (Just "a", ParaSpec { paraSpecPos = ParaItem 1 ["-a"]
34--                         , paraSpecReqP = ["-a"], ... })
35--   , (Just "ab", ParaSpec { paraSpecPos = ParaItem 2 ["-a","-b"]
36--                          , paraSpecReqP = ["-a","-b"], ... }) ]
37--
38parseParaList :: [String] -> [(Maybe S.ParaTag, S.ParaSpec String)]
39parseParaList = map parseParaSingle
40
41-- | Parse single layout.
42--
43--   >>> parseParaSingle "ab : -a -b"
44--   (Just "ab", ParaSpec { paraSpecPos = ParaItem 2 ["-a","-b"]
45--                        , paraSpecReqP = ["-a","-b"], ...} )
46--
47parseParaSingle :: String -> (Maybe S.ParaTag, S.ParaSpec String)
48parseParaSingle = single where
49    single s  = case B.divide ':' s of
50                  [n, l]   -> (Just $ O.trimBoth n, layout l)
51                  [l]      -> (Nothing, layout l)
52                  _        -> paraBug "expect T:L or L" s
53
54    layout l  = case map words $ B.divide '.' l of
55                  [ps]      -> paraSpec ps []
56                  [ps, ns]  -> paraSpec ps ns
57                  _         -> paraBug "expect P or P.N" l
58
59paraSpec :: [String] -> [String] -> S.ParaSpec String
60paraSpec nsP nsN = S.paraSpec $ pos . req . opt where
61    pos  = paraSpecPos nsP
62    req  = S.paraReq $ ns False
63    opt  = S.paraOpt $ ns True
64    ns b = map snd $ filter (\n -> fst n == b) $ fmap paraString nsN
65
66paraString :: String -> (Bool, String)
67paraString n
68    | l == '?'    = (True,  i)
69    | otherwise   = (False, n)
70    where (i, l)  = initLast n
71
72paraSpecPos :: [String] -> S.ParaSpecMap String
73paraSpecPos ns =
74    case span isReq $ ror <$> ns of
75      (rs, [])                -> S.paraItem (unror <$> rs)
76      (rs, [Rest x])          -> S.paraItemRest (unror <$> rs) x
77      (rs, xs) | all isOpt xs -> S.paraItemOpt  (unror <$> rs) (unror <$> xs)
78               | otherwise    -> paraBug "expect N, N?, or N*" $ unwords ns
79
80-- | Report bug of parameter specification.
81paraBug :: String -> String -> a
82paraBug label x = B.bug $ "malformed layout (" ++ label ++ "): " ++ x
83
84
85-- ----------------------  ROR
86
87data Ror = Req String | Opt String | Rest String
88           deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
89
90ror :: String -> Ror
91ror n = case initLast n of
92          (n', '?') -> Opt  n'
93          (n', '*') -> Rest n'
94          _         -> Req  n
95
96unror :: Ror -> String
97unror (Req  n) = n
98unror (Opt  n) = n
99unror (Rest n) = n
100
101isReq :: Ror -> Bool
102isReq (Req _) = True
103isReq _       = False
104
105isOpt :: Ror -> Bool
106isOpt (Opt _) = True
107isOpt _       = False
108
109initLast :: [a] -> ([a], a)
110initLast n = (init n, last n)
111
112
113-- $Layout
114--
115-- Syntax for parameter layout.
116--
117-- == Multiple (layout)
118--
119--   * __Single__                — Single layout
120--   * __Single @|@ Multiple__   — Multiple layout
121--
122--  Set of tagged layouts.
123--
124--   >>> parseParaSpec "a : -a | ab : -a -b"
125--   [ (Just "a",  ParaSpec { paraSpecPos = ParaItem 1 ["-a"], paraSpecReqP = ["-a"], ... })
126--   , (Just "ab", ParaSpec { paraSpecPos = ParaItem 2 ["-a","-b"], paraSpecReqP = ["-a","-b"], ... }) ]
127--
128-- == Single (layout)
129--
130--   * __Layout__                 — Layout without tag
131--   * __Word @:@ Layout__        — Layout with tag
132--
133-- == Layout
134--
135--   * __Positional__                — Positional parameters
136--   * __Positional @.@ Named__      — Positional and named parameters
137--
138--  Positional @-a@ and @-b@ parameters.
139--
140--   >>> parseParaSpec "-a -b"
141--   [ (Nothing, ParaSpec { paraSpecPos = ParaItem 2 ["-a","-b"]
142--                        , paraSpecReqP = ["-a","-b"], ... }) ]
143--
144--  No positional and one named required @c@ parameters.
145--
146--   >>> parseParaSpec ". -c"
147--   [ (Nothing, ParaSpec { paraSpecReqN = ["-c"], ... }) ]
148--
149--  Positional @a@, @b@, and named @c@ parameters.
150--
151--   >>> parseParaSpec "-a -b . -c"
152--   [ (Nothing, ParaSpec { paraSpecPos = ParaItem 2 ["-a","-b"]
153--                        , paraSpecReqP = ["-a","-b"]
154--                        , paraSpecOptP = []
155--                        , paraSpecReqN = ["-c"], ... }) ]
156--
157-- == Positional (parameter)
158--
159--   * __Word ...__                  — Positional required parameters
160--   * __Word ... Word@?@ ...__      — Positional required and optional parameters
161--   * __Word ... Word@*@__          — Positional required and rest parameters
162--
163--  Positional required @-a@ and optional @-b@ parameters.
164--
165--   >>> parseParaSpec "-a -b?"
166--   [ (Nothing, ParaSpec { paraSpecPos = ParaItemOpt 1 ["-a"] ["-b"]
167--                        , paraSpecReqP = ["-a"]
168--                        , paraSpecOptP = ["-b"] })]
169--
170--  Positional required @-a@ and rest @-b@ parameters.
171--
172--   >>> parseParaSpec "-a -b*"
173--   [ (Nothing, ParaSpec { paraSpecPos = ParaItemRest 1 ["-a"] "-b"
174--                        , paraSpecReqP = ["-a"]
175--                        , paraSpecOptP = ["-b"], ... }) ]
176--
177-- == Named (parameter)
178--
179--   * __Name ...__             — Named parameters
180--
181-- == Name
182--
183--   * __Word__                  — Named required parameter
184--   * __Word@?@__               — Named optional parameter
185--
186--  Named required @-a@ and optional @-b@ parameters.
187--
188--   >>> parseParaSpec ". -a -b?"
189--   [ (Nothing, ParaSpec { paraSpecReqN = ["-a"]
190--                        , paraSpecOptN = ["-b"], ... }) ]
191--
